newsitem.title: USA: Northland Cranberries to buy property.
newsitem.headline: Northland Cranberries to buy property.

text.p: Northland Cranberries Inc said Thursday it entered into an agreement in principle to acquire the stock of Atoka Cranberries Inc, the owner of North America's largest single-site cranberry marsh, for a total of $28.5 million.
The transaction is payable in $13 million in cash, with the remainder in Northland convertible notes.
Northland is the world's largest cranberry grower and makes 100-percent blended cranberry juice products. Atoka is one of the largest independent producers of cranberries.

Northland said Atoka, based in Quebec, has a total of 424 planted acres in various stages of maturity on 2,700 acres of land, with additional land and water resources available for future expansion of productive acreage.
Atoka would operate as a wholly owned subsidiary of Northland after the acquisition was completed, which is expected to occur wthin six weeeks after certain conditions are satisfied.
In addition to its cranberry operation, Atoka also handles and processes fruit at its own receiving station and juice processing facility.
Atoka markets fresh cranberries, cranberry juice, concentrate and cranberry sauce. A majority of its products are sold for use in private label products.

"This transaction should clearly reemphasize to our shareholders and competitors Northland's steadfast determination to continue accelerating our growth and ultimately become a significant force in the consumer food products industry," John Swendrowski, president, said in a statement.
Northland's total planted acres with this deal will increase to 2,972.
